author: larestrepomu
title: SUAN Early carbon removal market
description: Low access to coverage and volume of climate-smart projects in developing countries for investors and companies

f6_assessments.q0:
The Suan Blockchain project aims to use Cardano's technology to enable the trading of climate assets for a greater number of people and with less bureaucracy compared to the way these negotiations take place today. Thus, it is possible to see that the proposal is in accordance with the goals established by the challenge. And imagining a successful scenario for the project, we would have a positive impact on Cardano's ecosystem, as another possibility of using technology, in this case influencing to reduce environmental pollution.

The asking amount of $99,000 doesn't seem too out of the ordinary given the technological implementation the project will involve. However, the possible impact of this project is closely related to the existence of a simpler way to access these assets and trade them, and we realized that the proposal focused a lot on describing the most far-fetched steps without citing many practical examples of how the logic of negotiation. This seems to jeopardize the possible impact of the project, as the message it aims to convey is not very clear at the moment.
f6_assessments.q1:
The steps that describe the feasibility of the project are conveying a very technical character, which can make it difficult for the end user and even other companies to understand the process. We know that the idea is to make climate assets available at an early stage to be traded, and that there will also be a whole logic for the legal validation of these assets and for the establishment of their value over time. But the lack of some graphic material to better convey the business logic made it difficult to understand the steps after the purchase of one of these assets.

However, we realized that the team responsible for the project was appointed, and the curricula were made available. Observing the experiences of these professionals, we noticed that their skills are complementary for a good execution of the project, contemplating not only development skills, but also in the areas of growth and entrepreneurship. It is also interesting to note that there is a pilot plan, considering a specific location, which helps a lot in the feasibility of the project.

Regarding the budget details, we have that the largest portion, $70,000, is being allocated to the production of technological components, which is quite plausible since this was the main focus of the feasibility plan. We noticed, however, that there was no defined plan more focused on the marketing of the initiative, which would be a very important point, given the objective of the proposal to attract more people to invest in this market.
f6_assessments.q2:
Given all the aspects developed in the feasibility plan, we noted the need for well-defined quantitative parameters to monitor the evolution of the project. And we see that a very important parameter is stated here, the linking of 500,000 CO2 to the ecosystem.

But it seems interesting that other metrics were also enunciated as ways to measure the project's progress, for example, how many users got to know the platform in the last month? Did these users already have prior knowledge about the market or made any investments? What is the volume of transactions of these assets? What type of asset is most traded? We noticed that the absence of a greater number of parameters makes it more difficult to understand how the project works.

But it is worth noting that the concept of the Suan Blockchain project seems to have the potential to be disruptive in the market in which it intends to operate, with the possibility of popularizing investment in this type of asset and creating a considerable impact on environmental conservation. It seems interesting that some concepts could be explained in a more intuitive way at first.

f6_assessments.q0: I really like the idea of a project that can incorporate blockchain technology into the emission control process to protect the environment. A groundbreaking idea that contributes to a greener earth. It will shape the values brought to users to raise awareness of environmental protection. Specific document citations help the community to gain more information.
f6_assessments.q1: I agree on the future roadmaps of work to accomplish the ideas outlined. Expenditure budget for each work item is reasonable. However, it will be more specific and transparent if you can provide more detailed information of each member of the project, a link to the information page on Github or Linkedin will be more intuitive. With another small suggestion, I would like to know more about the protocol how you get data from outside the environment from oracles, what is your criteria for choosing a trusted oracle?
f6_assessments.q2: I agree with KPIs to measure project success with metrics to standardize the measurement. However, I read carefully in the proposal but still do not see the details of specific timelines to complete the work. Having a specific timeline helps you calculate the things you need to do and stick to the progress.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal provides a B2B or C2B solution buy designing and operating a platform for carbon creadits issuance and trading. 
The project will create a token which will represent the carbon captured by the registered participants and later on these credits will be traceable on the market created.
The project wants to create an equal opportunity for carbon capturing amongst all participants regardless of size. At the moment it is difficult for small farmers to issue carbon credits even if they actively use carbon sequestering practices.
If the project is successful it will be in line with the challenge objectives.
I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project identifies risks a proposes solutions for mitigation of these risks. 
The proposal is not clearly explained and even though I have read it three times I still can not understand it fully. I will advise the proposers, for the next proposal to use a professional writer or spend more time on structuring the information they want to present. 
The proposal wants to start the project with a property El Paramo Los Laureles, located in the "Finca Los Laureles", Vereda Azul, jurisdiction of the municipality of Murillo. However it is not clear if this property is owned, by who, or if it is rented, by who and for how much, and what exactly is the plan in order for this property to be accepted as a carbon sequestering project by the international carbon credit issuers.
The project presents a road map but does not attach a timeline to that roadmap. 
The proposer presents a rudimentary budget divided in 3 parts, development and implementation for $70K, growth for $19K and pilot for $10K that is all, no more detail in the budget. No hourly rate, number of employed people their specialties etc.
The team is presented with names and positions and all members of the teal are with linkedin profiles.
The proposer calls for new hires, 8 people with different expertise, mainly software related and management.
 I have checked the website of the Suan Blockchain Inc and it looks like this company is recently created and the website is just a frame and needs content. 
What is very VERY strange is that the team that shows on the website https://www.suan.global/about-us is absolutely different with the team presented in the proposal. 
This lights a lot of red lamps in my mind and I could not trust this proposal until these issues are resolved.
I strongly disagree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The auditability section is presented by a primary purpose to link 500 000Tons of CO2eq to the ecosystem, but it does not specify when and how. 
The proposers state that they will make 8 releases on github (the webpage is not specified) in order for the community to follow the development on the road map. 
And finally the launch of the marketplace. 
There is no clear way shown to audit this proposal by the auditors. There are no milestones and timelines for the auditor to compare to.
I disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal aims at developing a blockchain-enabled marketplace for the trade of climate assets (forestry, agroforestry, conservation, energy, transportation etc.) available to everyone, regardless of the project stage, capital constrains of stakeholders and other factors, with an initial POC for the moorlands of “Páramo Los Laureles" located in the municipality of Murillo, Tolima, Colombia.
While the proposal has ample descriptions of how it can impact the world at large and the world of blockchain, it fails to explain in simple terms the concepts of the climate assets tokens and what exactly they will contain (especially as metadata on the blockchain), how they are traded, what utility they offer, what impact each transaction will have etc. 
While I can see great potential with this project, failing to properly understand the intricacies and base layer of it, compels me to be neutral in its impact evaluation.
f6_assessments.q1:
While the steps described in the plan are detailed, the timeline is non-existent as there are no timeframes attached to each step, nor is there an interval specified, that would offer some details on how long it will take to have the project implemented.
The budget is divided into 3 main categories: “Develop and implement technology modules: USD 70,000”, “Growth: USD19,000” and “Pilot: USD10,000”, with some extra descriptions added, but no measurement provided on how these numbers have been calculated (number of hours needed per category/skill, cost per hour etc.). As such, it is impossible to determine the feasibility of the budget and whether it is enough or too much for this project.
The team has provided some information on the founding team members, with Linkedin links attached, and also a list of other team members they are needing to recruit after funding. While the team, in its beginning stage, seems to be qualified, the plan and budget of the proposal are not clear, thus I am unable to properly evaluate the successful implementation of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The evolution progress has been well identified and can be easily verified by the community via Github. The success description is also well delineated, with clear milestones for identification. Regarding the milestone itself,  “500,000 tons of CO2eq ” available for trade on the platform is a number that I cannot estimate whether it is realistic or not, as it’s neither clear from the text of the proposal and neither do I possess sufficient knowledge to opine on that.  As such, I will take the word of the proposers and presume it is a realistic, achievable amount.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal provides a clear problem statement and proposed solution that addresses the need for a blockchain based carbon market. This concept in my opinion is likely the single most important, potentially world saving app that this space needs. As an environmentalist that has studied the problem in depth, I would love to see this project be successful. However, I have several doubts about the feasibility and auditability of this proposal as I will discuss below. For this reason I give 4 stars, as I do not see this project as one that will be driving a significant number of users to Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The team provides their website, which seems incomplete and lacking the professionalism one would expect of a blockchain development company capable of delivering a global carbon market. The website appears to be a mix of english and Spanish and the "about us" page contains placeholder text that is not relevant. The social media links on their website do not work, so there is no way to confirm the reach the proposing team may have in regards to marketing their solution. Furthermore the names of the Suan company CEO, CTO, CFO, and directors do not match the names provided in the proposal. They have not provided sufficient details on how they will convert the pilot project property into carbon credits, or if these carbon credits will be considered equivalent to other carbon credits traded on other markets.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal clarity/auditability has been rated only 2 stars because the proposal does not include a timeline or estimate for completion. The budget is provided, but it is not clear if this is a final cost to deliver all the elements discussed in the proposal, or if this is just for the initial pilot project: "Pilot: 
The deployment of the project will be carried out by piloting the tokenization of the natural reserve called: El Paramo Los Laureles"
The roadmap goes on to say "Other potentials: Advanced verification technologies. Ex: Computer vision for biomass calculation from aerial or satellite images." but it's not clear what elements are within the scope of this budget, and which are not. 
I would encourage the team to revise this proposal, and I hope to see an improved roadmap, budget and detailed plan in future funding rounds.

solution: This is an early carbon removal, blockchain-enabled marketplace that allows for trading and leveraging early stage climate-smart assets.
experience: Over 80 years and 200 technology projects and accumulated experience in investment valuation, IP asset portfolios, innovation, green business, development frameworks, cloud services, data science, blockchain, Stake Pool Operator and Plutus Pioneer Program.
